title: Farzaneh: User study follow-up
body:
(This is a continuation of a Farzaneh's Fellowship project--putting it here for status tracking)

1/3/23 - Currently, 2 more users are/were needed for a publishable study. Sent an inquiry to Farzaneh to see if she will be continuing. Late fall recruitment did not attract any users. Recruitment will need more of a concerted effort.

title: DCE Data: Explore possible project? (leadership team decision)
body:
DCE = Harvard Extension School

Any MSFT interest?

From Dec 8th Leadership slack:

> Possible project: This week I talked with Jay Luker at the Division of Continuing Ed--they run the infrastructure for the Harvard extension school courses.
> They have been collecting course analytics for quite some time and have  ideas for projects to work with this data--but no bandwidth to do so.
> Especially with the data “next door”, this may be a great opportunity to learn more about their data and potentially do a project with the OpenDP library. (Including students? With Microsoft?). It brings in all the relevant real-world factors incl/ epsilon usage, FERPA, potentially longitudinal data, etc.
> (I’ll also email Cynthia about this.)

title: CS Course Enrollment Meeting (Jan. 20)

title: (Jan. 11, 2023) Intro meeting with AI.market (Max Robbins)
body:
Schedule an initial meeting

**11/22/22 Email:**

Hi Annie,

Thank you for the follow-up note.  We would be interested in scheduling an introductory call to include my CTO Eric Sexton.  

Our interest is in getting more detail about including the Smartnoise/openDP open source as a stock offering in ai.market.  We are trying to establish the most basic implementation so that users of the market can add this to “Their” data pipelines.  

We are additionally interested in resources that we can point these customers toward in the event that they need more sophisticated and/or complex solutions.

We are familiar with the software, but not experts.  We will have some specific questions about how easily its deployment can be made and what other considerations we need to be aware of.

Additionally we are quite keen to meet the team behind the development.  We hope that in addition to providing this as a service of the market we are able to become active contributors to the project and we move forward.

Please let us know what is convenient to your calendars.  I am in Spain so earlier in the day your time is best, but happy to accommodate.  If you have availability towards the end of next week that would be great.

Thanks
Max

title: DP for Digital Transaction Data: Rahul Matthan at National Payments Corporation of India

labels.name: org: National Payments Corporation of India

body:
On Fri, Aug 13, 2021 at 5:45 AM Rahul Matthan <Rahul.Matthan@trilegal.com> wrote:
Dear Salil,

I am writing to you on the recommendation of Satchit Balsari.

By way of introduction, I am a technology policy lawyer based in India with a special focus on privacy and data empowerment. I have been closely involved with a number of Indian developments in the data space and, most recently, was part of the Non-Personal Data Committee that has developed a new regime for unlocking value in anonymised aggregated datasets.

I am writing to you in relation to the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) that is looking to initiate a data sharing project that will make all the digital transaction data that passes through its switch publicly available for research in financial inclusion and public good. They plan to strip the data of all identifies and only share the (i) date, (ii) time, (iii) amount, (iv) geographic details, (v) nature/ purpose and (vi) meta data relating to the transaction. This, they hope, will appropriately anonymise the datasets but I had pointed out that they should think of doing more than just de-identifying the data. I briefly explained differential privacy to them and they were interested to explore this further. 

It is in this regard that I am writing to you to enquire if you might be interested in having a preliminary conversation with the NPCI on the subject. Their concern is to ensure that the datasets they release have been appropriately anonymised and would like to understand whether differential privacy (or any other anonymisation solution) would be more appropriate than what they have in mind. The focus is to preserve privacy while at the same time ensure that the data is available for research.

Do let me know if this is something that you would be interested in considering. I’d be happy to get on a call to discuss this in a bit more detail if required.

Regards,
Rahul

—

Rahul Matthan
Partner
Trilegal

Trilegal
Prestige Poseidon
139, Residency Road
Bangalore – 560025
 
Tel  +91-80-4343-4646
Dir  +91-80-4343-4600
Fax  +91-80-4343-4699
